messages.content: That is why we need an MP who understands the issues and concerns facing local people. We need a local champion who has the experience and local knowledge to fight for older people.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Pressing to restore the link between pensions and earnings.
Opposing the charges introduced for disabled parking.
Fighting the increased rents and heating bills imposed by the Conservative council.
Fighting for more local care in Community Hospital Beds.
Campaigning to allow people in their own homes for those unable to cope and for respite for their carers.
Working to achieve peace and quiet with adequate security measures to prevent anti-social behavior.
Reforming taxation so that those on average earnings pay £700 less in tax each year, while those with an income less than £10,000 a year will pay no income tax at all.

issues.health: Fighting for more local care in Community Hospital Beds.

housing.content: Fighting the increased rents and heating bills imposed by the Conservative council.

leaflet.personalStatement: I live, work and shop locally. I've been helping local people for the last 21 years.

contactInformation.address: 13 Alterton Close, Goldsworth Park, Woking, GU21 3DD

quotes.text: Rosie Sharpley is the only champion for Woking.

leaflet.additionalNotes: PS I live, work and shop locally. I've been helping local people for the last 21 years and would like you to support the candidate who has the best experience and the strongest local track record to get real change for Woking and older people.
